adrFormatAddress: 3151 Broadway, New York, NY 10027-4111, USA

editorialSummary.text: Casual cantina serving a variety of Mexican dishes, from fajitas to pozole, plus fruity cocktails.

originalText.text:
Delicious Mexican food, better than anything in Hells Kitchen.  Might be my new favorite in the city. Starting off with some free chips and salsa of very high quality, perfect really, like in the south. The shrimp Diablo are amazing and the sauce has a homemade taste, not too spicy. I ordered the chicken enchiladas which were nothing special but on par for top notch, great sauce. Both dishes came with homey rice and beans, very filling. We sat outside and enjoyed the fresh air. We did ask the waitress that brought our mains out (not that took our order) for more free chips and salsa and she said yes, but then the other server gave them to the wrong table, which was unfortunate because we wanted to use them to scoop up the accoutrements.  Oh well everyone makes mistakes. It was annoying to see the other table immediately grab and start munching away on our chips though - they didn’t ask for them and knew they weren’t theirs and could’ve said something but didn’t. Our server did bring us three different kinds of hot sauces that you can see in the photos.  But when they finally brought our chips and salsa we were finished with our meal. I just overhead a guy who seems like the owner offer free chips to the table next to me.
Anyway, overall strong recommend.

originalText.text: I went to this restaurant 3 days in a row, that is how good the food here is. The echiladas are to die for, highly recommend the green sauce if you can take spicy, and for the meats pulled pork or steak. Large portions and the best Mexican food. This will definitely be a regular place of mine!

text.text: I went to this restaurant 3 days in a row, that is how good the food here is. The echiladas are to die for, highly recommend the green sauce if you can take spicy, and for the meats pulled pork or steak. Large portions and the best Mexican food. This will definitely be a regular place of mine!

originalText.text:
I’ve been to El Porton so many times previously and was a huge fan. That’s why it’s so sad to leave this review.

My colleagues and I placed a to-go order last month. There were numerous things wrong with the order, unfortunately. One of which was that one colleague received the wrong item completely (received tacos instead of a taco salad). The other one was a piece of green thread inside the food of my other colleague. Truly disgusting. See attached photo.

I went back to the restaurant that same day and showed them the photo and also explained all of the various other items that were wrong with the order. They acknowledged the thread was the exact type used to tie their tortilla bags. I explained that I understand things happen, but we just needed to let someone know and make things right with us. I was advised to leave my phone number and someone would call me back.

I never heard back, so I went there once more a few weeks later (actually placed another pickup order) and let them know that no one had gotten back to me. Once again, they apologized and asked me to again leave my phone number so someone could call me back.

I never heard back this time around either and unfortunately have to leave this review. Truly disappointing. Due to them ignoring us, it will prevent my colleagues and I from ever stopping by again, which makes me sad as it was the opposite of my intention. I just wanted them to make their mistakes right.

originalText.text:
It’s a great place to enjoy authentic Mexican food~ reminded me of home. Food was so good that I forgot to take more pictures! Must get The Alambre and desert! Buñuelos, Michoacán fried Ice cream or Flan with coffee~ must get!
If the food is made with so much love, their service and attention will make you feel at home and relaxed.

originalText.text:
I visited this establishment on a Thursday afternoon, so there was only myself and two other customers there at the time. I ordered the Chicken, Shrimp, and Steak Fajitas. It was delicious and well seasoned! The waitress was well attentive and very kind, often refilling my water and regularly checking if I needed anything. The meal came with complementary chips and salsa, but I ordered a serving of guacamole.

The guacamole lacked flavor (in my opinion) [I’d give it a 3 out of 5 stars] and the salsa was underwhelming with too much cilantro [I’d give it a 3.7 out of 5 stars].

Overall, my experience was incredible, the food was mostly delicious and I would definitely visit again.
